info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 7:43PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR LA SALLE COUNTY... At 742 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Somonauk to 6 miles west of Streator, moving east at 60 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS. TAKE SHELTER IMMEDIATELY. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Streator, La Salle, Marseilles, Sheridan, Lake Holiday, Oglesby, Seneca, Somonauk, Earlville, North Utica, Serena, Leland, Tonica, Grand Ridge, Naplate, Millington, Dayton, Lostant and Ransom. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 41 and 47. I-80 between mile markers 81 and 103. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, north central and northeastern Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
